text: The Centre's net tax collections in the April-June 2022 quarter were nearly ₹7 lakh crore, up 24% YoY, as per data given by the government in the Lok Sabha. While ₹3.44 lakh crore was collected as indirect tax, ₹3.55 lakh crore was collected as direct tax. The Centre had set ₹19.35 lakh crore as FY23's net tax collection target.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: Income Tax dept raids 27 premises in Delhi, Mumbai; recovers ₹1.4 cr
text: Income Tax Department carried out search and seizure operations on July 5 on groups engaged in the agro and textile business and some others. A total of 27 premises were covered in Delhi-NCR and Mumbai and unaccounted cash worth ₹1.4 crore was seized. Incriminating evidence in the form of hard copy documents and digital data was also found and seized.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: ₹14,820 cr tax demand raised under black money law on foreign income
text: Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman on Monday said the Centre has raised a tax demand of ₹14,820 crore after completing assessment in 368 cases under the black money law dealing with undisclosed foreign income. Sitharaman said 648 disclosures involving undisclosed foreign assets worth ₹4,164 crore were made in the one-time three months compliance window. The window had closed in September 2015.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: GST Council looks at common man's interest, needs of revenue: Govt
text: Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman said the GST Council takes into account all relevant factors while making a recommendation and calibrates the common man's interest and needs of revenue. A simplified rate structure under GST, however, would ease compliance and provide greater transparency, she said. Council hasn't made any recommendation for change in existing GST rate slabs so far, she added.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: HDFC Bank to be among world's 10 most valuable banks post-merger: Report
text: HDFC Bank will be among world's top 10 most valuable banks after its merger with Housing Development Finance Corporation (HDFC), a Times of India report said. HDFC Bank has a market capitalisation of about $108 billion and recently moved past Citigroup, which was ranked 17th. It'll also be the first Indian bank to make it to the top 10 club.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: Never slowed or stopped investing in India: Richest Indian Adani
text: Richest India Gautam Adani said the Adani Group never slowed or stopped investing in India as the group's success is based on its alignment with India's growth story. The previously announced $70 billion investment in new energy business will help turn India into an exporter of clean energy, Adani said. "Our strength in renewables will empower us enormously," he added.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: Axis Bank's net profit nearly doubles to ₹4,125 crore in Q1 FY23
text: Axis Bank on Monday said its net profit rose 91% YoY from ₹2,160 crore in Q1 FY22 to ₹4,125 crore in Q1 FY23. The bank's net interest income in the April-June quarter grew 21% YoY to ₹9,384 crore while its non-performing assets declined to 2.76% from 3.85% in Q1 FY22. Its core operating profit grew 17% YoY to ₹6,554 crore.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: Amount involved in bank frauds dropped 88% to ₹3,785 cr in 2 yrs: Govt
text: Minister of State for Finance Bhagwat Karad on Monday said the amount involved in frauds reported by banks and financial institutions declined by 88% in two years. The amount reduced from ₹32,178 crore in 2019-20 to ₹3,785 crore in 2021-22, Karad added. According to a report, India's non-performing assets (NPAs) have dropped to a six-year low as of March 2022.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: Zomato share price falls by 14% to hit all-time low of ₹46
text: Zomato's share price declined by 14% on Monday to hit an all-time low of ₹46 during early trade as the one-year lock-in for promoters, shareholders, employees and others ended today. The stock had last closed at ₹53.65 on Friday. Zomato was listed on the markets on July 23, 2021, and hit its lifetime high of ₹169 apiece in November 2021.
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: Zomato investors lose ₹89,000 crore in 8 months as stock falls to record low
text: About ₹89,000 crore has been wiped out of Zomato investors' wealth in eight months as the food delivery company's stock fell to a record low on Monday. Shares of Zomato declined over 13% to ₹46 on the NSE in early trade. The company's market value declined to ₹36,848 crore, from a peak of over ₹1.25 lakh crore in November 2021.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: Google Co-founder gave Musk $500,000 for Tesla during 2008 financial crisis: Report
text: Google Co-founder Sergey Brin reportedly gave Elon Musk $500,000 for Tesla during the 2008 financial crisis, when the company was struggling to increase production. According to The Wall Street Journal report which stated that Musk had an affair with Brin's wife, the former gave Brin one of Tesla's first all-electric sports-utility vehicles in 2015.
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: What are the rates at which employees are leaving India's top IT companies?
text: Infosys has reported the highest rate at which employees are leaving the company among its Indian peers for April-June quarter, at 28.4%. The IT major is followed by HCL Tech with 23.8% employee attrition rate, Wipro at 23.3% and TCS at 19.7%. Meanwhile, Infosys added the most number of employees during the quarter, followed by Wipro, TCS and HCL Tech.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: Tesla planning same-hour service for cars using Formula 1 techniques
text: Tesla CEO Elon Musk on Saturday tweeted that the company is aiming at providing same-hour services for its vehicles. Musk tweeted, "Excited to work with Tesla Service to enable same-hour service as often as possible! Applying Formula 1 pit crew techniques to Teslas." Earlier in 2015, Tesla had hired F1 veteran Kenny Handkammer as Global Director of Service Innovation.
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: Vivo indulged in money laundering, challenged India's integrity: ED
text: The Enforcement Directorate told the Delhi High Court that Vivo India indulged in money laundering to destabilise the financial system and challenge the integrity and sovereignty of the country. In an affidavit, ED said Vivo India incorporated 22 firms in different states which allegedly laundered money. It added that it is scanning the suspicious financial transactions of these 22 firms.
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: Policybazaar reports IT systems breach, says 'No significant customer data exposed'
text: Insurance aggregator Policybazaar said that its IT systems were subject to illegal and unauthorised access, however, "no significant" customer data was exposed. In a regulatory filing to the exchanges, the company said that the unauthorised access was reported on July 19 and that it has also fixed the vulnerabilities identified in its IT systems.
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: DGCA begins special audit of airlines after surge in technical issues
text: The DGCA has started a two-month-long special audit of airlines after several technical malfunction incidents took place in planes during the last 45 days. The audit will focus on facilities like hangars, equipment being used by airline personnel, airlines' quality assurance system, duty time limitations and airlines' maintenance control centre, among others.
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: A person of extraordinary courage: Mahindra on President Droupadi Murmu
text: Mahindra Group Chairman Anand Mahindra on Monday took to Twitter to praise India’s 15th President, Droupadi Murmu. Sharing a video, Mahindra wrote, "Look no further for your Monday Motivation. Above all else, she is a person of extraordinary courage and a commitment to serve. Her inner strength has enabled her to withstand all the challenges life has thrown at her."
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: Airtel Chairman Sunil Mittal's salary falls nearly 5% to ₹15.39 crore in FY22
text: Bharti Airtel Chairman Sunil Mittal's salary fell nearly 5% in the financial year 2021-22 to ₹15.39 crore. In the year 2020-21, Mittal's gross remuneration stood at ₹16.19 crore. In 2021-22, Mittal's perquisites stood at ₹83 lakh, against ₹1.62 crore in the previous fiscal. Meanwhile, Bharti Airtel MD Gopal Vittal's salary rose 5.8% in FY22 to ₹15.25 crore.
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: Musk dropped to one knee, begged forgiveness from Brin over affair with wife: Report
text: Tesla CEO Elon Musk reportedly "dropped to one knee" in front of Google Co-founder Sergey Brin at a party while apologising and begging for forgiveness for an alleged affair with his wife, Nicole Shanahan. While Brin acknowledged the apology, he isn't speaking to Musk regularly, the report added. Meanwhile, Musk dismissed the report, calling the alleged affair "total bs".
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: Stock markets record best week since Feb 2021; Sensex & Nifty gain over 4%
text: Stock markets closed at their highest level in seven weeks on Friday to record their best week since February 2021. While BSE Sensex gained 390 points and finished at 56,072, Nifty rose 0.7% to settle at 16,719.45 on Friday. Both the indexes hit their highest since June 3 and gained over 4% this week.
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: Will support whatever Elon decides: Binance CEO on Musk's Twitter deal
text: Cryptocurrency exchange Binance's CEO Changpeng Zhao spoke about Tesla CEO Elon Musk's decision regarding the $44 billion Twitter acquisition deal. After a Twitter user asked him to "buy Twitter", Zhao replied, "It might be slightly overpriced. But will support whatever Elon decides. There is a time to lead, and a time to follow."
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: Infosys' profit rises 3.2% to ₹5,360 crore y-o-y, revenue jumps 23.6% to ₹34,470 crore
text: Infosys, India's second largest IT services provider, on Sunday reported a consolidated net profit of ₹5,360 crore for the first quarter, up 3.2% year-on-year from ₹5,195 crore recorded in Q1FY22. The IT major's consolidated revenue stood at ₹34,470 crore, up 23.6% from ₹27,896 crore recorded during the same quarter of the previous fiscal year.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: Character assassination reached new level: Musk on report of dating Brin's wife
text: Responding to a report about his alleged affair with Google Co-founder Sergey Brin's wife Nicole Shanahan, the world's richest person Elon Musk said that "character assassination attacks have reached a new level this year". While Musk denied the alleged affair, he added, "I work crazy hours, so there just isn’t much time for shenanigans."
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: Credit Suisse planning more job cuts to reduce expenses: Report
text: Switzerland's second-biggest bank Credit Suisse is reportedly considering a fresh round of job cuts and other measures in order to cut expenses. The bank had warned in June that it would post a loss for the quarter, its third in a row. Last month, the bank announced job cuts in its Asia's investment team.
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: Infosys hired 21,171 people in first quarter, headcount rose to 3,35,186
text: Infosys, India's second largest IT services provider, hired 21,171 people the first quarter of FY23, the company said while announcing its results for Q1 today. The company's headcount was 3,35,186 as of June 30, up from 3,14,015 last quarter. Infosys reported a consolidated net profit of ₹5,360 crore for the first quarter ended June 2022.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: Volkswagen CEO Herbert Diess to step down, Porsche CEO to succeed him
text: Herbert Diess, the Volkswagen CEO who was caught up in the automaker's emissions-cheating scandal, will step down "by mutual consent" on September 1, Volkswagen announced on Friday. He'll be succeeded by Porsche CEO Oliver Blume, who'll retain his current position too. Diess had earlier reportedly clashed with Volkswagen's labour representatives over issues including top personnel decisions.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: Uber admits covering up 2016 hacking, avoids prosecution in US settlement
text: Uber on Friday accepted that its personnel failed to report a data breach that affected 57 million passengers and drivers in 2016, as part of a settlement with US prosecutors to avoid criminal charges. Uber waited about a year to report the breach, said US Attorney Stephanie Hinds. Uber is also cooperating with former security officer Joseph Sullivan's prosecution.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: RBI correct to use forex reserves to tackle Rupee volatility: EAC member
text: Sanjeev Sanyal, a member of Economic Advisory Council (EAC) to the Prime Minister, said RBI is "correct to use" foreign exchange reserves to tackle Rupee's volatility. "There's no point targeting an INR/USD level when USD is appreciating against all other [major currencies]," Sanyal said. "We need to maintain overall macro-stability and allow the cycle to play itself out," he added.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: Sun Pharma, Glenmark recall products in US over manufacturing issues
text: Mumbai-headquartered drug makers Sun Pharma and Glenmark are recalling products in the US due to lapses in their manufacturing processes, as per a latest enforcement report by US Food and Drug Administration. The report states that Sun Pharma is recalling 50,680 vials of Testosterone Cypionate Injection and Glenmark is recalling 98,307 packs of a medication used for treating skin conditions.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: Tech Mahindra, Mahindra University to set up lab for Metaverse
text: Tech Mahindra and Mahindra University signed a Memorandum of Understanding (MoU) to set up a Makers Lab for research and development in quantum computing, explainable Artificial Intelligence and Metaverse. The lab, to be established in Hyderabad, will be the 11th facility globally. Mahindra University Vice Chancellor Yajulu Medury said that the MoU is an academia-industry collaboration.
author: Anisha Joneja

headlines: No port, vessel related charges on coastal shipping for 6 months: Govt
text: Major ports have been directed to exempt coastal shipping operations from port and vessel charges for the next six months, an official statement said on Sunday. Ports, Shipping and Waterways Minister Sarbananda Sonowal has also asked states to lower VAT on diesel used by the shipping sector. Sonowal also requested Centre to reduce rates and taxes on fuel for ferries.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: 9 of top 10 most valued firms add ₹2.98 lakh crore in m-cap in past week
text: Nine of the top 10 most valued firms added ₹2.98 lakh crore to their market valuation last week. While Reliance Industries' market capitalisation jumped by ₹68,564.65 crore to ₹16,93,245.73 crore, the valuation of Tata Consultancy Services surged by ₹64,929.87 crore to ₹11,60,285.19 crore. Infosys, Bajaj Finance, HDFC Bank and SBI were among the other gainers.
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: Chitra told ED that staff's phones were tapped to check information leak: Officials
text: Former NSE MD Chitra Ramkrishna has told the Enforcement Directorate that monitoring of phones at the bourses was done to ensure there was no leak of critical data such as passwords and other reports to the competitors, said officials. Meanwhile, ED said her act was clear "illegal interception" as employees were not aware that their calls were put under surveillance.
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: FPIs invest net ₹1,099 cr from July 1-22, break 9-month selling streak
text: Foreign portfolio investors (FPIs) invested net ₹1,099 crore in Indian equities between July 1-22 and broke their nine-month long selling streak, data with depositories showed. This comes after FPIs withdrew net ₹50,145 crore from equities in June, the highest net outflow since March 2020. So far this year, FPIs have pulled out around ₹2.16 lakh crore from equities.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: LG VK Saxena calls for CBI probe into Delhi government's excise policy
text: Delhi Lieutenant Governor VK Saxena called for a CBI probe into the alleged violation of the Delhi Excise Policy. This comes after Delhi Chief Secretary filed a report showing prima facie violations of various policies. There were "deliberate and gross procedural lapses" made by Manish Sisodia. Delhi government allegedly extended "undue favours" to liquor licensees after tenders had been awarded.
author: Atul Mishra

headlines: 65-yr-old Mindtree Co-founder Subroto Bagchi to complete his DU degree 40 yrs later
text: With Delhi University permitting former students to complete their degree exams as part of its centenary programme, 65-year-old Subroto Bagchi, Co-founder of Mindtree, tweeted he is a "student again" and will complete his only "unfinished task". Bagchi said that he was enrolled in the Law Faculty in 1978 but couldn’t complete his degree as he had to leave Delhi.
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: Musk’s team underestimated court's ability: Judge as it sets Oct trial for Twitter case
text: A Delaware judge while ruling that Twitter’s lawsuit against Tesla CEO Elon Musk over the $44 billion deal will be held in October, said his team underestimated the "court’s ability to quickly process complex litigation". Chancellor Kathaleen St. Jude McCormick added, "Delay threatens irreparable harm." Musk’s team while opposing Twitter's expedited trial bid, suggested it be held next year.
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: Twitter spent $33 million on Elon Musk's takeover deal in three months
text: Twitter spent $33 million on its pending acquisition by the world's richest person Elon Musk during the second quarter of 2022, the company revealed in its earnings release. Twitter also partially blamed Musk for the "uncertainty" surrounding the deal for a decline in its quarterly revenue. Earlier this month, Twitter sued Musk after he proposed terminating the $44 billion deal.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: Google freezes hiring for 2 weeks to 'review headcount needs'
text: Google has announced that it will be freezing hiring for two weeks. In an email to the staff, Google's Senior Vice President Prabhakar Raghavan wrote, "We’ll use this time to review our headcount needs." This communication comes after the company recently announced that it would be slowing down its hiring process for the remaining year.
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: 2 Indian brothers, their friend charged in first crypto insider trading case in US
text: Two Indian brothers and their Indian-American friend have been charged in the first-ever insider trading scheme involving cryptocurrencies in US. Former Coinbase manager Ishan Wahi, his brother Nikhil Wahi and Sameer Ramani used confidential information about which crypto assets were set to be listed on the platform's exchanges. They made illegal trades, realising $1.5 million in illicit profits.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: US-based firm Meta.is to sue Meta for stealing its name
text: A US-based virtual reality company META.is is suing Meta for allegedly stealing its name and violating the company’s established brand. Meta.is in a post wrote, "Facebook seized our META mark and name, which we put our blood, sweat and tears into building for over 12 years." It added that it had discussed a potential partnership with Facebook in 2017.
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: Musk is doing his best to run us down, it’s attempted sabotage: Twitter
text: Twitter's attorney argued that Tesla CEO Elon Musk is "doing his best to run Twitter down" after he terminated the $44 billion deal. William Savitt said, "It’s attempted sabotage." Musk's attorney Andrew Rossman replied, the Tesla CEO has "no interest in damaging the company" and is Twitter’s second-largest shareholder with a "far larger stake" than its entire board of directors.
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: $130 billion wiped off social media companies' market value in a day
text: American social media companies lost more than $130 billion from their combined stock market value on Friday. The wipeout comes after Twitter and Snap's quarterly results raised concerns about the outlook for online advertising. Shares of Snap fell 39% to its lowest level since March 2020, whereas Alphabet stock declined 5.6% in its biggest one-day drop in over 2 years.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: $80 billion wiped off combined m-cap of companies that sell online ads in a day
text: About $80 billion was wiped out of the combined market value of companies that sell online ads after Snap reported poor quarterly results. While shares of Alphabet fell 3%, wiping out over $40 billion from its market capitalisation, Meta Platforms dropped 5%, erasing about $25 billion in market value. Snap shares fell 25%, cutting its market value by $7 billion.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: 79-yr-old Ashok Soota launches his 3rd startup, aims to take it to IPO in 5 yrs
text: Entrepreneur Ashok Soota, 79, has launched his latest venture Happiest Health, which he aims to take to IPO in five years. Soota worked at Wipro from 1985 to 1999, after which he quit and co-founded rival company Mindtree Limited, bringing it to an IPO in 2007. He then founded Happiest Minds Technologies in 2011, which had its IPO in 2020.
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: Ford rolls out last car from Chennai plant as it ends production in India
text: Ford India rolled out its last car, EcoSport, from its Chennai manufacturing plant in Tamil Nadu ahead of its formal closure of the unit. Last year, Ford announced that it will end its manufacturing operations in India due to losses. Several visuals of the last unit decorated with flowers and balloons, along with the staff were shared on social media.
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: SC allows govt to continue with security cover for Mukesh Ambani, family
text: The Supreme Court on Friday allowed the Centre to continue providing security cover for Reliance Industries' Mukesh Ambani and his family in Mumbai. A vacation bench on June 29 had stayed the orders of Tripura HC on a PIL challenging the grant of security cover to the family. The SC said there was no justification for it to be heard.
author: Shreyasi Banerjee

headlines: No plan to extend July 31 deadline for filing income tax returns: Govt
text: The government is not considering extending the July 31, 2022, deadline for filing income tax returns, Revenue Secretary Tarun Bajaj said on Friday. "People thought the routine now is that dates will be extended...They were a little slow in filing the returns initially," he told PTI. However, Bajaj said that 15-18 lakh income tax returns are being filed per day.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: Gas supply to Europe through biggest pipeline between Russia and Germany resumes
text: Russian gas has resumed flowing through the biggest pipeline between Russia and Germany. The Nord Stream 1 gas pipeline reopened on Thursday, after being closed for annual maintenance work for 10 days, according to the pipeline operator. Earlier, Russian President Vladimir Putin warned that supplies sent via the pipeline to Europe could be reduced further and might even stop.
author: Ankush Verma

headlines: European Central Bank raises interest rates for first time in 11 years
text: The European Central Bank (ECB) on Thursday raised interest rates for the first time in more than 11 years. The ECB raised its key interest rate by 0.5 percentage points to 0.0%. The ECB said that the increase is necessary to limit the pressure on prices over the next two years. It also increased its main refinancing rate to 0.50%.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: Adani adds more wealth than anyone else, gets richer by $36 billion this year
text: Adani Group's Chairman Gautam Adani has added nearly $36 billion to his wealth this year, more than anyone else among the world's 500 richest people, as per Bloomberg. Adani recently overtook Bill Gates to become the world's fourth richest person with a net worth of $112 billion. Notably, Adani recently pledged $7.7 billion to charity to mark his 60th birthday.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: Journalist shares pic of IndiGo MD having biscuit & tea onboard, Twitter users react
text: A journalist on Friday shared a photo of IndiGo’s Promoter and MD Rahul Bhatia eating a Parle-G biscuit dipped in tea onboard. He wrote, "[This] shows you don't have to be Richard Branson or Vijay Mallya to build a successful airline with 57% market share." Meanwhile, a Twitter user wrote, "Grounded and down to earth", and another commented, "That's simplicity!"
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: ED seizes jewels, bank deposits worth ₹253 crore of Nirav Modi's firms in Hong Kong
text: The Enforcement Directorate has attached gems, jewellery and bank deposits worth ₹253.62 crore of companies linked to fugitive diamond merchant Nirav Modi in Hong Kong as part of a money laundering probe. With this, the total attached and seized assets tally in the case stands at ₹2,650.07 crore, the ED said. Nirav is presently lodged in a UK jail.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: 7-Eleven fires around 800 employees in US citing business restructuring
text: Convenience store chain 7-Eleven has fired about 800 people in the US citing business restructuring. The chain is owned by the Japanese retail conglomerate Seven & i Holdings. Last year in May, the 7-Eleven store chain completed the $21 billion acquisition of its rival Speedway convenience store chain from Marathon Petroleum.
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: Reliance Industries' profit jumps 46% to ₹17,955 crore, revenue up 54% in Q1
text: Mukesh Ambani-led Reliance Industries Limited's (RIL) consolidated net profit jumped 46.3% to ₹17,955 crore in the April-June quarter from ₹12,273 crore a year ago. Meanwhile, RIL's revenue from operations came in at ₹2,23,113 crore from ₹1,44,372 crore, an increase of 54.5% year-on-year. Further, Reliance Jio reported 23.8% rise in standalone net profit at ₹4,335 crore in Q1.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: May shift business from Zomato, Swiggy if commissions rise: Domino's
text: Jubilant FoodWorks, which runs the Domino's and Dunkin' Donuts chain in India, has said that it will consider taking some of its business away from Zomato and Swiggy, if their commissions rise further. The company was responding to the Competition Commission of India, which is investigating the alleged anti-competitive practices of Zomato and Swiggy.
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: RBI has zero tolerance for rupee volatility & bumpy movements: Guv
text: As the Indian rupee touched new lows against the US dollar in the last few months, RBI Governor Shaktikanta Das said, "We have zero tolerance for volatile and bumpy movement of the rupee." He added that while the rupee is better placed than other currencies against the US dollar, the RBI continues to remain watchful of headwinds.
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: NCLT orders insolvency proceedings against Future Retail
text: The Mumbai bench of National Company Law Tribunal (NCLT) on Wednesday allowed a consortium of lenders, led by Bank of India (BoI), to initiate insolvency proceedings against debt-laden Future Retail. The tribunal also rejected e-commerce major Amazon's objection to BoI's petition. Amazon had alleged that the petition to initiate insolvency proceedings against the Indian retailer was "malicious".
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: Goa tourism body demands rollback of GST hike on small, medium hotels
text: The Travel and Tourism Association of Goa (TTAG) demanded a rollback on hike in GST rate for small and medium hotels, saying it will make them uncompetitive and lead to increase in compliance costs. After the implementation of the new GST rates, hotels with tariffs below ₹1,000 per night will now have to pay 12% GST which was 0% earlier.
author: Subhangi Singh

headlines: Rupee's depreciation against US$ lower than other key currencies: CEA
text: Indian Rupee's depreciation against the US$ has been lower than that of other major global currencies, said Chief Economic Advisor V Anantha Nageswaran. "You look at the Japanese Yen and the British Pound. They all have depreciated much more against the US$," Nageswaran said. "RBI is managing the monetary policy and has announced liberalised rules to attract inflows," he added.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: Rupee hits 80 per US dollar for the first time ever
text: The Indian rupee touched 80 per US dollar for the first time ever on Tuesday after opening at 79.99 per dollar. The rupee declined for the eighth consecutive session after crude oil surged on concerns about tighter supplies globally. At the time of writing, rupee was trading at 80.01 per dollar, after touching a fresh record low of 80.02.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: ED arrests ex-Mumbai Police chief Sanjay Pandey in NSE phone tapping case
text: The Enforcement Directorate (ED) on Tuesday arrested former Mumbai Police Commissioner Sanjay Pandey in connection with a money laundering case linked to the alleged illegal phone tapping of National Stock Exchange (NSE) employees. The 1986-batch IPS officer retired from service on June 30. He has also served as the acting Maharashtra director general of police.
author: Deepika Bhatt

headlines: Who are now the world's 10 richest people as Adani becomes 4th richest?
text: Gautam Adani has overtaken Bill Gates to become the world's fourth richest person with a $114 billion fortune, said Forbes. Elon Musk is the world's richest with $230 billion wealth, followed by Bernard Arnault ($148 billion) and Jeff Bezos ($139 billion). Larry Ellison, Warren Buffett, and Larry Page rank 6th, 7th and 8th on the world's 10 richest people list.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: Gautam Adani overtakes Bill Gates to become world's 4th richest person: Forbes
text: Gautam Adani has overtaken Bill Gates to become the world's fourth richest person, according to Forbes. The development comes after the Microsoft Co-founder announced plans to donate $20 billion to his non-profit Bill & Melinda Gates Foundation. Gates' net worth now stands at over $102 billion, whereas Adani Group's 60-year-old Chairman has a fortune of more than $114 billion.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: List of items exempt from GST when sold loose released by Finance Minister
text: Amid criticism over pre-packaged and pre-labelled food items getting costlier after 5% GST was levied on them, Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman released a list of items GST Council has exempt from GST if they are sold loose. They include pulses, wheat, rice and curd among others. "The decision is of GST Council and no one member," she clarified.
author: Arshiya Chopra

headlines: Tesla sells 75% of its Bitcoin holdings
text: Tesla, which revealed a major investment in Bitcoin, has now sold off most of its holdings of the cryptocurrency. The electric carmaker said it had offloaded 75% of its Bitcoin, adding that it bought traditional currency with the $936 million from its Bitcoin sales. Tesla's $1.5 billion investment in Bitcoin prompted a surge in demand for the currency.
author: Ankush Verma

headlines: Twitter accuses Musk of 'slow-walking' trial, says 'it is harming us each day'
text: Twitter has accused the world's richest person Elon Musk of trying to "slow walk" the company's lawsuit against him for backing out of the $44-billion deal. "Millions of Twitter shares trade daily under a cloud of Musk-created doubt...This very public dispute harms Twitter with each passing day," Twitter said, urging the judge to hold a trial at earliest possible date.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: Netflix loses nearly 1 million subscribers in 2nd quarter; share price rises
text: Netflix has said in its earnings report that it lost 970,000 subscribers in the second quarter, which was less than two million it forecast during its first quarter report in April. After Netflix lost 200,000 subscribers in the first quarter, its shares fell around 67% this year. However, the shares rose 7% to $216 in after-hours trading following latest results.
author: Arshiya Chopra

headlines: Flipkart's Cleartrip suffers data breach, no sensitive info compromised
text: Global online travel company Cleartrip suffered a data breach on Monday, according to the company's email to its customers. "There has been a security anomaly that entailed illegal and unauthorised access to a part of Cleartrip's internal systems," the email read. While some personal details were a part of the leak, no sensitive information was compromised, the Flipkart-owned firm said.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: Reliance Jio submits highest deposit of ₹14,000 crore for 5G spectrum auction
text: Reliance Jio Infocomm submitted the highest earnest money deposit of ₹14,000 crore for upcoming 5G spectrum auction, as per the Department of Telecommunications data. Bharti Airtel and Vodafone Idea have deposited ₹5,500 crore and ₹2,200 crore as earnest money, respectively. Meanwhile, Adani Data Networks, which earlier said it has no plans to enter consumer mobility segment, deposited ₹100 crore.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: Apple shares fall on report of plans to slow hiring, spending for some teams
text: Shares of Apple fell 2% on Monday after Bloomberg reported that the iPhone maker is planning to slow hiring and limit expenditures at some of its divisions next year. The potential move would see Apple joining tech giants like Meta, Google and Tesla which have announced similar plans. Apple has 154,000 full-time equivalent employees, as per its last annual report.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: Elon Musk planning to countersue Twitter over $44 billion buyout deal: Report
text: World's richest person Elon Musk is planning to countersue Twitter after the company sued him for backing out of the $44 billion buyout deal, the New York Post reported. Musk has 20 days from the date of filing of Twitter's lawsuit to file his counterclaims. Twitter has accused Musk of attempting to "trash the company, disrupt its operations...and walk away".
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: Govt shares data showing changes in value of Indian rupee against US dollar since 2014
text: The government has shared data showing changes in the value of Indian rupee against US dollar since 2014. As per the government, the value of rupee against the US dollar has depreciated by more than 25% from December 31, 2014 to July 11, 2022. On Tuesday, the Indian rupee touched 80 per the US dollar for the first time ever.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: Govt releases rules for Work from Home for Special Economic Zones
text: The Ministry of Commerce & Industry has released rules for Work from Home for Special Economic Zones. "WFH allowed for a maximum period of one-year; may be extended to maximum 50% of total employees including contractual employees," it said. "Development Commissioners of SEZs empowered to extend it beyond one-year and for more than 50% of total employees," the ministry added.
author: Ankush Verma

headlines: It is going to be a tough 2022 and possibly an even tougher 2023: IMF chief
text: In a blog on global economy, International Monetary Fund chief Kristalina Georgieva wrote, "It's going to be a tough 2022—and possibly an even tougher 2023, with increased risk of recession." "Inflation is higher than expected and has broadened beyond food and energy prices," Georgieva said, adding, "We'll be projecting a further downgrade to global growth for both 2022 and 2023."
author: Ankush Verma

headlines: India's richest woman Savitri Jindal's fortune rose by $12 billion in two years: Forbes
text: India's richest woman Savitri Jindal witnessed her fortune rise by $12 billion in the last two years, according to Forbes. Jindal's net worth stood at $4.8 billion in 2020 and it has surged to $17.7 billion this year. The 72-year-old is the head of the OP Jindal Group, founded by her late husband Om Prakash Jindal in 1952.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: No plan to exempt cryptocurrency transactions from taxes: Govt
text: Minister of State for Finance Pankaj Chaudhary said the government is not considering any plan to reduce taxes on cryptocurrency transactions. In Budget 2022, the government had announced a flat 30% tax on income from cryptocurrencies and a 1% TDS on cryptocurrency transactions. Chaudhary said RBI has also started working on phased implementation of introduction of the Digital Rupee.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: No state opposed 5% GST on food items at Council meet: Officials
text: No state opposed the move to bring pre-packaged commodities under GST in the 47th GST Council meeting, a senior official present in the meeting said. The Union Finance Minister is the Chairperson of the GST Council and states' Finance Ministers are its members. The rate rationalisations took place based on recommendations of a group of ministers (GoM), another official said.
author: Subhangi Singh

headlines: DDA must register real estate projects with us: Delhi-RERA Chairman
text: Delhi Development Authority (DDA) must register its real-estate projects with the regulator to protect the interest of property buyers, said Delhi-Real Estate Regulatory Authority (RERA) Chairman Anand Kumar. Delhi-RERA has the power to take action against organisations that fail to register projects with them, he said. "If DDA delays [its] project...who is going to suffer? The buyer," he added.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: Kerala won't impose GST on essential items sold by small stores: Minister
text: Kerala government on Tuesday said that it would not impose GST on items sold by organisations like Kudumbashree or small stores in 1 or 2-kilogram packets or in loose quantities. The decision might lead to issues with the Centre, state Finance Minister KN Balagopal said. "Yesterday too, CM Pinarayi Vijayan wrote to the Centre regarding these things," he added.
author: Atul Mishra

headlines: Hope to complete Sri Lanka aid talks as soon as possible: IMF chief
text: International Monetary Fund (IMF) hopes to complete negotiations with Sri Lanka on a bailout package "as quickly as possible", IMF MD Kristalina Georgieva said. "The moment there is a government [in Sri Lanka], we can continue our discussions and our team will be there," Georgieva said. Sri Lanka needs about $5 billion in next six months to cover basic necessities.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: Wipro's net profit falls 21% YoY to ₹2,564 cr in Q1, revenue up 16%
text: Wipro Limited on Wednesday reported a 20.93% YoY decline in its consolidated profit after tax to ₹2,563.6 crore for the March-June quarter. The company's consolidated revenue, however, rose 15.51% YoY to ₹22,001 crore in Q1 FY23, up from ₹19,045 crore in Q1 FY22. "At 15% of operating margins, we believe that we have bottomed out," said Wipro CFO Jatin Dalal.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: Hindustan Unilever's net profit rises 14% YoY to ₹2,391 cr in Q1
text: Hindustan Unilever Limited (HUL) on Tuesday reported a 13.85% YoY rise in its consolidated net profit to ₹2,391 crore for the March-June quarter. Its standalone net profit was at ₹2,191 crore. HUL's revenue from operations rose 19.46% YoY to ₹14,331 crore while its earnings before interest, taxes, depreciation and amortisation (EBITDA) margin was at 23.2% in Q1 FY23.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: Follow ringmaster US Federal Reserve to save local currency: Uday Kotak
text: Kotak Mahindra Bank CEO Uday Kotak on Tuesday said central banks which don't follow "ringmaster US Federal Reserve" have their local currencies crushed. "Look at Japan, a 30%+ depreciation. That's the power of the US $," Kotak tweeted. He added that central banks globally take a cue from the US Federal Reserve and decide their monetary policies accordingly.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: Not considering any proposal to merge SAIL, Rashtriya Ispat Nigam Ltd: Govt
text: Minister of State for Steel Faggan Singh Kulaste on Monday said no proposal to merge Steel Authority of India Limited (SAIL) and Rashtriya Ispat Nigam Limited (RINL) is under consideration. The government has proposed selling 100% stake in RINL along with management control by way of privatisation. The state-run steelmaker has been bearing losses for the last few years.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: India on course to achieve 8-8.5% growth based on Q1 data: Govt
text: India is on course to achieve projected 8-8.5% growth based on high frequency indicators for the first quarter of FY23, the Finance Ministry said on Tuesday. Minister of State for Finance Pankaj Chaudhary said the government has cut excise duty on petrol and diesel and special excise duty/cess on petrol, diesel and jet fuel exports to ensure continued growth momentum.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: MahaRERA to issue show-cause notices to 4,555 lapsed projects: Report
text: Maharashtra Real Estate Regulatory Authority (MahaRERA) will start issuing suo motu show-cause notices to developers of 4,555 lapsed real estate projects in the state from July 25, Moneycontrol reported citing senior MahaRERA officials. Of the 4,555 lapsed projects, Pune and Mumbai account for 1,216 and 649 lapsed projects. Notices will initially be issued to projects with over 50% booking.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: Rupee hits record low of 79.97 against US dollar
text: The rupee hit a record low of 79.97 against the US dollar on Monday after opening at 79.76. The Finance Ministry, while speaking about the matter said that global factors such as the Russia-Ukraine war, soaring crude oil prices and tightening of global financial conditions are the major reasons for the rupee's weakening.
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: Rupee closes at an all-time low of 79.98 against US dollar
text: The rupee on Monday hit a fresh record low as it ended closer to the 80-mark to close at 79.98 against the US dollar. This was the seventh consecutive session when the rupee weakened. So far this year, the currency has weakened 7.05% against the US dollar. Meanwhile, BSE Sensex closed 760 points higher at 54,521 on Monday.
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: You all call me fugitive, which court has ever convicted me: Lalit Modi
text: Lalit Modi on Sunday took to Instagram to speak about various issues after he revealed his relationship with Sushmita Sen. He wrote, "[Though you all] call me a "fugitive"...tell me which court has ever convicted me...None…Everyone knows how difficult it is to do business in India." Speaking about IPL, he said, “Everyone...knows that I did it all alone"
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: A fighter to the core: Mahindra praises PV Sindhu after she wins Singapore Open
text: Businessman Anand Mahindra took to Twitter to praise PV Sindhu after she won the Singapore Open. Sharing a tweet by Doordarshan Sports which had an old image of Sindhu, Mahindra wrote, "That’s not just her facial expression, but the expression of her soul. A fighter to the core...Never getting demoralised by a slump. Teaching us how to rise again."
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: BCCI had ₹40 cr in bank when I joined & ₹47,680 cr when I was banned: Lalit
text: In an Instagram post, Lalit Modi asserted that he neither took any government favour nor any bribes from anyone. He added, “I was born with a diamond spoon...When I joined BCCI, it had ₹40 crore in the bank. I joined on my birthday on November 29, 2005. Guess what was in the bank when I was banned - ₹47,680 crore."
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: It is not a sacrifice at all: Bill Gates on plan to give away all his wealth
text: Microsoft Co-founder Bill Gates, who plans to give away all his wealth, said, "My giving this money is not a sacrifice at all." He added, "I feel privileged to be involved in tackling these great challenges...and I believe I have an obligation to return my resources to society." Gates is currently the world's fourth richest person with $113 billion wealth.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: 11 SEBI officials' email accounts hacked & used to send 34 emails, FIR filed
text: Mumbai police has filed an FIR after the Securities and Exchange Board of India (SEBI) approached them, alleging the email accounts of its 11 officials had been hacked and used to send as many as 34 emails by unknown persons. "It was a small incident. CERT-IN is fully in the loop. No sensitive data was lost," the markets regulator said.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: RBI is of the view that cryptocurrencies should be prohibited: FM Sitharaman
text: The Reserve Bank of India (RBI) has recommended to the government that it should frame regulations for cryptocurrencies and is of the view that they should be prohibited, Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman said. Citing the borderless nature of cryptocurrencies, she further said that any legislation for regulation or for banning can be effective only after significant international collaboration.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: How a startup should operate: Mahindra on old video of Man City's 44-pass goal
text: Businessman Anand Mahindra took to Twitter to share a 2018 video of Manchester City's 44-pass goal against Manchester United and wrote, "A lesson in teamwork...But also an analogy for how a startup...needs to operate." He further said that success comes from going "back and forth, trying new angles of approach and going for the kill when strategic path is clear".
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: Ex-NSE CEO Chitra's remand extended by 4 days in money laundering case
text: A Delhi court has extended the four-day remand of former CEO and MD of National Stock Exchange (NSE), Chitra Ramkrishna, in a money laundering case. The case involves alleged phone tapping and snooping of NSE's employees. Earlier, the Enforcement Directorate and CBI registered two more cases against Ramkrishna, former NSE head Ravi Narain and former Mumbai Police Commissioner Sanjay Pandey.
author: Shreyasi Banerjee

headlines: Lalit shares pics with PM Modi & others amid trolling, says 'was born with diamond spoon'
text: While criticising people trolling him over his relationship with Sushmita Sen, Lalit Modi shared old pictures with PM Narendra Modi, Amit Shah, UK Prince Charles, Dalai Lama, Nelson Mandela among other personalities. He said he doesn't care about people calling him a fugitive, adding, "I was born with a 'diamond spoon'. I didn't take a bribe or ever needed to."
author: Arshiya Chopra

headlines: Which household items will get costlier from tomorrow due to changes in GST rules?
text: Pre-packaged and labelled food items like curd, lassi and buttermilk will get costlier from July 18 as they'll attract 5% GST. Jaggery, khandsari sugar, puffed rice will no longer be exempt from GST. Kitchen utensils like knives, spoons, forks, and stationery items like pencil sharpeners, maps, globes and electrical appliances such as LED lights and fixtures will also get costlier.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: New Zealand inflation surges to 7.3%, highest since 1990
text: Inflation in New Zealand has surged at its fastest pace in over three decades. As per official data, the Consumer Price Index increased 7.3% in the second quarter, up from 6.9% in the first quarter and the fastest since the June quarter of 1990 when prices rose 7.6%. Economists had predicted that inflation would come in at 7% or 7.1%.
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: Saudi Arabia doubled Russian oil imports in Q2, freeing up own oil for exports: Report
text: The world's largest oil exporter, Saudi Arabia, more than doubled its Russian oil imports in the second quarter, enabling it to free up its own crude for export, as per data accessed by Reuters. It imported 6,47,000 tonnes of Russian oil from April to June. Russia has been selling fuel at discounted prices amid Western sanctions over the Ukraine war.
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: Sunak praises father-in-law Narayana Murthy, says 'His firm employs thousands in UK'
text: One of the frontrunners for the UK PM's post, Rishi Sunak, said he is proud of what his parents-in-law built. Speaking about Infosys Founder NR Narayana Murthy, Sunak said, "My father-in-law came from...nothing and just had a dream and a couple of hundred pounds [from my] mother-in-law's savings…He...built one of the world's largest...companies that...employs thousands of people...in the UK."
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: What goods & services get cheaper as new GST rates come into effect today?
text: Electric vehicles, whether or not fitted with a battery pack, will be eligible for the concessional GST rate of 5% from July 18. GST on renting trucks, and goods carriages (where the cost of fuel is included) will be cut to 12% from 18%. GST on ostomy appliances and orthopaedic equipment like splints will be reduced from 12% to 5%.
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: Pakistani rupee falls to all-time low of 212 against US dollar
text: The Pakistani rupee has dropped to a record low against the US dollar with the exchange rate sliding to PKR 212, local media reported on Monday. This fall in the value came after traders resorted to panic buying on reports that some commercial banks had run out of foreign currency, reports stated.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: HUL, ITC, United Spirits added 130 execs to crorepati club last fiscal: Report
text: Hindustan Unilever (HUL), ITC and United Spirits together added over 130 executives to the club of those earning more than ₹1 crore annually during the last fiscal, The Economic Times reported. United Spirits witnessed a massive jump of 113%, whereas HUL and ITC saw 33% and 44% increase in the number of eight-figure salary earners, as per their annual reports.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: Bill & Melinda Gates Foundation's half resources have come from Warren: Bill Gates
text: In a blog, Microsoft Co-founder Bill Gates said that though the foundation is named Bill & Melinda Gates Foundation, "half of its resources to date have come from Warren Buffett's gifts". Gates wrote, "Since 2006, Warren has gifted the foundation $35.7 billion, including his most recent gift of $3.1 billion in June."
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: Fortune cooking oil prices cut by up to ₹30 per litre by Adani Wilmar
text: Prices of one of the most popular Indian edible oil brands Fortune have been cut by up to ₹30 per litre amid a fall in global prices. This is the second oil price reduction announced by the brand's maker Adani Wilmar in two months. Prices of soyabean and sunflower oils have been cut to ₹165 and ₹195 per litre, respectively.
author: Sakshita Khosla

headlines: No GST on pre-packed, labelled food items weighing over 25 kg: Finance Ministry
text: The Finance Ministry has clarified that single packages of pre-packed and labelled food items like cereals and pulses weighing over 25 kg are exempt from 5% GST. It added that if a retail shopkeeper supplies an item in a loose quantity that was bought in a 25-kg pack from a manufacturer, its sale to the consumer will not attract GST.
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: Plea to stop SpiceJet's operations amid recent mishaps dismissed by Delhi HC
text: The Delhi High Court dismissed a plea seeking to stop the operations of SpiceJet over recent technical snags. The plea cited several incidents involving SpiceJet flights and claimed that passengers' lives are at risk due to their improper management. The DGCA has taken note of incidents involving SpiceJet flights and is free to proceed on its own, the court noted.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: SEBI clears appointment of BSE chief Ashish Chauhan as new NSE CEO & MD
text: The Securities and Exchange Board of India has approved the appointment of Ashish Kumar Chauhan as the new MD and CEO of the NSE. Chauhan is currently the MD and CEO of the BSE and will replace Vikram Limaye whose term ended as NSE chief on July 16. The appointment is subject to Chauhan accepting the offer.
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: Hyd authority's one-time scheme offers 90% waiver on property tax arrears
text: The Telangana government has announced a one-time scheme (OTS) for clearing pending property tax arrears within Greater Hyderabad Municipal Corporation (GHMC) limits and all other urban local bodies. The scheme will allow a waiver of 90% on interest payment, provided that the principal amount plus 10% of interest on accumulated arrears is paid in one go for financial year 2021-22.
author: Subhangi Singh

headlines: Scindia chairs meet with heads of airline companies on safety issues
text: Civil Aviation Minister Jyotiraditya Scindia chaired a one-on-one meeting with heads of airline companies on Monday to review flight safety norms. The Aviation Ministry also issued instructions to each airline to take steps at all levels to enhance security surveillance. These steps come after a few Indian airlines reported back-to-back incidents of emergency landings due to technical issues.
author: Subhangi Singh

headlines: 6 of top 10 most valued firms lost ₹1.68 lakh crore in m-cap last week
text: Among the 10 most valued firms, six companies suffered a combined loss of ₹1.68 lakh crore in their market valuation last week. While TCS took the biggest hit as its market valuation declined by ₹99,270.07 crore to reach ₹10,95,355.32 crore, it was followed by Infosys, whose valuation dropped by ₹35,133.64 crore to ₹6,01,900.14 crore.
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: Swedish fashion retailer H&M to exit Russia amid Ukraine war
text: Swedish fashion retailer H&M said that it will exit from Russia after pausing sales there in March after Moscow's invasion of Ukraine. "After careful consideration, we see it as impossible given the current situation to continue our business in Russia," Chief Executive Helena Helmersson said in a statement. H&M said the move will cost $200 million and affect 6,000 staff.
author: Anisha Joneja

headlines: World's biggest NFT marketplace OpenSea fires 20% staff citing 'crypto winter'
text: The world's first and biggest NFT marketplace OpenSea has fired 20% of its employees citing "cryptocurrency winter" and "broad macroeconomic instability". CEO Devin Finzer shared the news on Twitter and said the affected employees will be provided with a generous severance and healthcare coverage into 2023. He added that the company will also help in the placement of these employees.
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: Twitter's lawsuit against Musk gets 90-min 1st court hearing on July 19
text: Twitter’s lawsuit against Tesla CEO Elon Musk over terminating the $44 billion acquisition deal will be first heard in court on July 19. Kathaleen McCormick, the Chancellor of Delaware's Court of Chancery, has set a 90-minute hearing. Notably, Twitter has requested that the trial begins in September because the merger agreement with Musk terminates on October 25.
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: Musk accused lawyers of causing trouble by seeking deal's financing info: Twitter
text: In its lawsuit against Tesla CEO Elon Musk, Twitter has shared a purported image of a text message that Musk sent to CEO Parag Agrawal before terminating the deal. Musk's message read, "Your lawyers are using these conversations to cause trouble….That needs to stop." Musk's message was in response to the company seeking information regarding the deal's financing.
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: Twitter's sudden speed for trial after 2 months of foot-dragging is a tactic: Musk
text: Tesla CEO Elon Musk has opposed Twitter's request for a fast-track trial over the $44 billion deal termination. In a filing, Musk said, "Twitter's sudden request for warp speed after two months of foot-dragging...is its latest tactic to shroud the truth about spam accounts long enough to railroad defendants into closing." Twitter has requested that the trial begin in September.
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: Will prove our position in court & we believe we'll prevail: Twitter CEO to staff
text: Following a lawsuit against Tesla CEO Elon Musk over the $44 billion acquisition agreement, Twitter CEO Parag Agrawal told his staff, "We will prove our position in court and we believe we will prevail." Twitter's lawsuit has accused Musk of "a long list" of violations of the merger agreement that "cast a pall over Twitter and its business".
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: Amazon pauses work on 6 new US office buildings to redesign for hybrid work
text: Amazon is pausing construction of six new office buildings in Bellevue and Nashville as it seeks to redesign workspaces for hybrid work. "We want to make sure that we design them in a way that meets our employees' needs in future," Amazon said. Amazon's plan to create 30,000 jobs in Bellevue and Nashville won't be affected by the construction pause.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: Like all firms, we are not immune to economic headwinds: Google CEO to staff
text: In an internal memo to the staff, Google CEO Sundar Pichai while announcing the company’s plan to slow its hiring, said, "Like all companies, we’re not immune to economic headwinds". He added, “The uncertain global economic outlook has been top of mind...We’ve never viewed these types of challenges as obstacles. Instead, we’ve seen them as opportunities to deepen our focus."
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: Unjustifiable request: Musk files motion against Twitter's bid to fast-track trial
text: Tesla CEO Elon Musk has filed a motion opposing Twitter's request to fast-track a trial over the $44 billion deal, terming it an "unjustifiable request". While Twitter has requested the trial begin in September because the merger agreement with Musk terminates on October 25, Musk has requested a trial date on or after February 13, 2023.
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: No plans for company-wide layoffs: Twitter amid lawsuit against Musk
text: In a filing, Twitter has said that it isn't looking at company-wide layoffs but could continue to restructure the business. The filing comes a day after it sued Tesla CEO Elon Musk for violating his $44 billion deal. In May, Twitter said it would pause hiring and review all existing job offers to determine whether any "should be pulled back".
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: Google to slow hiring for rest of the year: CEO Pichai tells employees
text: Google CEO Sundar Pichai in an internal memo to the staff has announced that they will be "slowing down the pace of hiring for the rest of the year" amid an uncertain global economic outlook. He added, Google will focus on hiring for "critical roles" and will be "pausing development" in some cases and "re-deploying resources to higher priority areas".
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: Withdraw GST on healthcare services: IMA writes letter to Finance Minister
text: The Indian Medical Association (IMA) has written a letter to Union Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman requesting to exempt healthcare services from GST. Citing various recommendations by the 47th GST Council on certain facilities that were earlier exempted from GST and will be taxed post-July 18, IMA said the cost "will add a significant additional cost to the healthcare of people."
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: Sula Vineyards to go public, files IPO papers with SEBI
text: Nashik-based Sula Vineyards has filed draft papers with the Securities and Exchange Board of India to raise capital through an IPO. The IPO will be entirely an offer for sale (OFS) with up to 25,546,186 equity shares put up for sale. The company has not finalised the date or price of the IPO as yet.
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: IndiGo not following maintenance procedures, technicians tell Airbus; airline replies
text: IndiGo's technicians have written a letter to aircraft manufacturer Airbus complaining that the airline is not following standard maintenance procedures leading to risking passengers' safety. They said the technical staff has been on a strike for a couple of days and the airline is operating flights without proper maintenance. Meanwhile, IndiGo denied the allegations, calling them "baseless".
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: Twitter-Musk case to be overseen by Delaware business court's 1st female chief judge
text: The first female chief judge on Delaware’s business court will oversee Twitter’s lawsuit against Tesla CEO Elon Musk for violating the $44 billion acquisition agreement. Kathaleen McCormick took over the role of chancellor, or chief judge, last year. McCormick's final ruling on the merger can be appealed to the Delaware Supreme Court.
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: Who are the highest-paid FMCG CEOs in India in FY22?
text: Marico’s MD and CEO Saugata Gupta emerged as the highest-paid FMCG CEO as his total pay in FY22 jumped by 157% from ₹14.03 crore in FY21 to ₹36.1 crore in FY22. Gupta is followed by HUL's Sanjiv Mehta at ₹22 crore salary, Nestle's Suresh Narayanan (₹18.80 crore), Dabur India's Mohit Malhotra (₹14.60 crore) and ITC's Sanjiv Puri (₹12.59 crore).
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: Jet fuel prices cut by 2.2%; second reduction this year
text: Aviation Turbine Fuel prices were reduced by 2.2% on Saturday, reflecting a fall in international oil prices. The prices were cut by ₹3,084.94 per kilolitre to ₹1,38,147.93/kl. This is only the second reduction in rates this year. Prices had peaked at ₹1,41,232.87/kl last month. Overall, ATF rates have been hiked 11 times since the start of this year.
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: Celsius becomes 3rd major crypto firm to file for bankruptcy in 3 weeks
text: Celsius has become the third major crypto firm to file for bankruptcy in three weeks following the collapse of hedge fund Three Arrows Capital and broker Voyager Digital. The crypto lender said the decision was part of a financial restructuring that would "stabilise the business". The US-based platform had suspended customer withdrawals, swaps and transfers citing "extreme market conditions".
author: Apurva Bharadwaj

headlines: Crypto must come under auto info-exchange mechanism: FM Sitharaman to G20
text: Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman told the group of 20 major economies to consider bringing cryptocurrencies under the ambit of the automatic exchange of information mechanism. The mechanism exists among countries to curb tax evasion. She said that investigations have shown tax evaders resorting to numerous layers of entities to mask their unaccounted wealth.
author: Apurva Bharadwaj

headlines: Almost all states prepared draft rules on labour codes: Bhupender Yadav
text: Union Minister Bhupender Yadav has said that almost all Indian states have prepared draft rules on the four labour codes. "Almost all states have finalised draft rules...We will implement the codes [in one go] at an appropriate time," Yadav said. He added that there are a few Northeastern states, including Meghalaya, which have not completed the process yet.
author: Mohammad Anab

headlines: RBI likely to introduce new rules for fintech firms: Report
text: The Reserve Bank of India (RBI) is likely to announce new regulations for fintech companies, Moneycontrol reported. The rules will likely cover areas such as data sharing, privacy, compliance with KYC and anti-money laundering norms, the report said. This comes in the wake of complaints related to some fintechs charging usurious interest rates and other issues, the report added.
author: Apurva Bharadwaj

headlines: Chinese economy shrinks by 2.6% in Apr-Jun quarter
text: The Chinese economy shrank by 2.6% in the April-June quarter this year, as experts forecasted Beijing missing its 5.5% growth target for this financial year. This is China's weakest quarterly growth since the beginning of the pandemic. The April-June quarter was marked by the lockdowns in Shanghai and other cities as China fought to contain the coronavirus outbreak.
author: Indraneel Sen

headlines: India's long-term growth prospects embedded in public capex programmes: FM
text: Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman said India's long-term growth prospects are embedded in public capital expenditure programmes. Speaking at the third G20 Finance Ministers and Central Bank Governors meeting in Bali, she added that evidence-based policy making is vital for resilient economic systems. She had raised capital expenditure by 35.4% for 2022-23 to ₹7.5 lakh crore to boost demand.
author: Apurva Bharadwaj

headlines: Attach bank accounts of person in Shree Ramkrishna Electro case: SEBI
text: SEBI has ordered the attachment of bank accounts along with share and mutual fund holdings of an individual to recover about ₹18 crore in the Shree Ramkrishna Electro Controls case. The recovery proceedings have been ordered against Chandrakant Bhargav Gole to recover ₹5.74 crore collected by the company along with ₹12.53 crore at 15% interest per annum.
author: Apurva Bharadwaj

headlines: Adani Ports to buy Israel's Haifa Port with local firm for $1.18 bn
text: Adani Ports and Special Economic Zone have won a bid to acquire Israel's Haifa Port with local firm Gadot Group for $1.18 billion, Israel announced on Thursday. Adani Ports and Special Economic Zone will have a 70% stake and Gadot will hold the remaining 30%. Adani Ports said the acquisition will boost trade lanes with its Indian ports.
author: Apurva Bharadwaj

headlines: Federal Bank's profit jumps 63% y-o-y to ₹600 crore, share price rises
text: The share price of private sector lender Federal Bank rose by 1.54% to ₹98.80 after it reported a 63.5% increase in net profit in the April-June quarter to ₹600.66 crore. The bank had reported a profit of ₹367 crore in the same period last year. Meanwhile, its net interest income rose by 13% to ₹1,604.5 crore.
author: Apurva Bharadwaj

headlines: States' fiscal deficit may rise to ₹8.4 lakh cr due to high capex: ICRA
text: States' fiscal deficit may rise to ₹8.4 lakh crore as they've budgeted 36% higher capital expenditure during 2022-23, an ICRA report said. As many as 26 large states, except Assam, have spent ₹5 lakh crore in capex, a 34% rise from FY20, it added. In budget estimates, these states have pegged their revenue receipts at ₹35.8 lakh crore.
author: Apurva Bharadwaj

headlines: RBI's new settlement system unlikely to be used widely: Capital Economics
text: The Reserve Bank of India's (RBI) new system for settling international trade in rupees is unlikely to be used widely, Capital Economics said. Assistant Economist Adam Hoyes said that most global trade is settled in dollars because settling it in alternative currencies is usually more expensive. The depth and liquidity of dollar markets make dollars a cheaper option, he added.
author: Apurva Bharadwaj

headlines: Twitter sues Elon Musk for backing out of $44 billion deal
text: Twitter has sued Elon Musk for violating his $44 billion deal to buy the social media platform. "Musk apparently believes that he...is free to change his mind, trash the company...and walk away," said the lawsuit. Musk said he was terminating the deal because Twitter violated the agreement by failing to respond to requests for information regarding fake or spam accounts.
author: Ankush Verma

headlines: Delhi HC allows Vivo to operate bank accounts if it furnishes bank guarantee of ₹950 cr
text: The Delhi High Court has allowed Chinese smartphone manufacturer Vivo to operate its bank accounts if it furnishes a bank guarantee of ₹950 crore. The court has also directed Vivo to maintain ₹250 crore in its accounts. Vivo India on Friday approached the court challenging the freezing of its bank accounts by ED in connection with a money laundering case.
author: Ankush Verma

headlines: 'Oh the irony lol' tweets Elon Musk after Twitter sues him
text: Minutes after news surfaced that Twitter has sued him for breaching the $44 billion contract, Tesla CEO Elon Musk took to the microblogging site and tweeted, "Oh the irony lol". As per The Verge, the lawsuit was filed in Delaware's Court of Chancery, accusing Musk of hypocrisy. Twitter is represented by M&A law firm Wachtell, Lipton, Rosen & Katz.
author: Apaar Sharma

headlines: DRI detects customs duty evasion of ₹4,389 crore by Oppo India
text: The Directorate of Revenue Intelligence (DRI) has detected customs duty evasion of nearly ₹4,389 crore by Oppo India. Searches were conducted by DRI at office of Oppo India and residences of its key management employees. This led to the recovery of incriminating evidence indicating wilful mis-declaration in the description of certain items imported by Oppo India.
author: Ankush Verma

headlines: Rupee edges closer to 80 per US dollar, opens at record low of 79.94
text: The rupee on Friday opened at a record low of 79.94 against the US dollar. So far this year, the US dollar is up 7% against the Indian currency. On Thursday, the currency had closed at another record low of 79.90 against the US dollar. Meanwhile, BSE Sensex jumped 316 points to 53,733 in Friday's early session.
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: Rupee hits new lifetime low of 79.67 per US dollar
text: The Indian rupee hit a new record low of 79.67 for a third straight session on Wednesday. In the previous session, the rupee had collapsed to close at 79.60 against the dollar. "There is a general risk-off sentiment. Until flows come back, we will see the dollar being bid against currencies like ours," a senior trader told Reuters.
author: Apaar Sharma

headlines: Rupee closes at all-time low of 79.60 against US dollar
text: The Indian rupee ended at a record low of 79.60 (provisional) against the US dollar on Tuesday. The currency witnessed an intra-day high of 79.53 and a low of 79.66 against the US dollar in Tuesday’s trade. Meanwhile, the euro reached parity with the US dollar for the first time in 20 years on Tuesday.
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: Rupee drops 9 paise to close at all-time low of 79.90 against US dollar
text: The rupee declined by 9 paise to close at a new record low of 79.90 against the US dollar on Thursday. At the interbank foreign exchange market, the local currency opened at 79.72 and witnessed intra-day high of 79.71 and a low of 79.92 against the US dollar. Meanwhile, brent crude futures, the global oil benchmark, dropped 2.20% to $97.38/barrel.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: Euro falls below $1 for the first time in nearly 20 years
text: The euro dropped below parity against the US dollar on Wednesday for the first time in almost 20 years. Euro was trading at around $0.998 at 12:45 pm GMT, down 0.4% in 24 hours, marking its lowest level since December 2002, Reuters reported. The euro has lost more than 10% so far this year.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: Twitter uses Musk's old poop reaction to CEO's tweet as evidence in court, he reacts
text: Twitter has used Tesla CEO Elon Musk's poop reaction to one of CEO Parag Agrawal's tweets on spam accounts in May as evidence against him in court. The Twitter lawsuit alleged that Musk has repeatedly disparaged Twitter and created business risk for the company. Meanwhile, reacting to this, Musk used another poop emoji and wrote, "= bs".
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: Elon has a real record of success: LinkedIn Co-founder defends Musk against Trump
text: LinkedIn's billionaire Co-founder Reid Hoffman defended Tesla CEO Elon Musk after former US President Donald Trump called the former a "bullshit artist" over the $44 billion Twitter deal. Hoffman tweeted, "Elon's a classic American immigrant story- an entrepreneur with a real record of success…[Whereas] Trump is a spoiled rich kid who bankrupts everything he touches. Including the US economy."
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: 550 women sue Uber in US, say they were 'raped, harassed' by drivers; firm responds
text: Uber has been sued in the US by 550 women who claimed they "were kidnapped, sexually assaulted, sexually battered, raped, stalked, harassed, or otherwise attacked by Uber drivers". "Sexual assault is a horrific crime and we take every single report seriously," an Uber spokesperson said. "There is nothing more important than safety," the spokesperson further said.
author: Ankush Verma

headlines: I'll eventually be out of the list of world's richest people: Gates on donation plans
text: Bill Gates has said, "As I look to the future, my plan is to give all my wealth to the Gates Foundation other than what I spend on myself and my family." "I do some...investing in US health care issues...outside the foundation," he added. "I'll move down and eventually off of the list of the world's richest people," he stated.
author: Ankush Verma

headlines: Moved to UK overnight: Agarwal on how he became 1st Indian to list firm in London market
text:
Vedanta Chairman Anil Agarwal posted an old picture and shared how he became the first Indian
to list his firm on the London Stock Exchange in 2003. He wrote, "My wife...thought I was crazy when I told her that we are moving to London overnight...I didn't have much when I arrived...but had...the...blessings of my margdarshak (guide)- my parents."
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: US inflation hits new 4-decade high of 9.1% in June
text: The consumer price index (CPI) in the US jumped in June 2022 at its fastest year-over-year pace since the end of 1981, the US Bureau of Labor Statistics reported. Inflation rose 9.1% in June 2022 from the same month a year ago. Excluding food and energy, the core CPI rose 5.9%, compared with the 5.7% estimate.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: ED arrests former NSE CEO Chitra Ramkrishna, gets 4-day remand in money laundering case
text: The ED arrested former CEO and MD of NSE Chitra Ramkrishna in a money laundering case and got a four-day remand. The ED filed the case in connection with the illegal phone tapping case and the snooping case of employees of the stock exchange. In March, Chitra was arrested by CBI in connection with the NSE co-location case in Delhi.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: HCL Tech Q1 profit rises 2.11% to ₹3,281 crore, company declares ₹10 dividend
text: HCL Technologies on Tuesday reported a consolidated net profit of ₹3,281 crore in the June quarter, up 2.11% from ₹3,213 crore in the corresponding quarter last year. The company's consolidated revenue increased by 16.92% to ₹23,464 crore as against ₹20,068 crore reported in the year-ago period. The company has declared a dividend of ₹10 per share.
author: Apurva Bharadwaj

headlines: Govt will raise funds from capital market for road projects: Gadkari
text: Union Transport Minister Nitin Gadkari said on Tuesday that the government will raise funds from capital markets for road projects. "I don't want to use the finances of rich people. I'm going to share market, and...I'm going to take investments from small people," he said. The construction equipment industry is facing problems due to rising crude oil prices, he added.
author: Apurva Bharadwaj

headlines: India's sugar, onion exports affected due to Sri Lankan crisis: Report
text: The ongoing economic crisis in Sri Lanka has affected the Indian exports of sugar and onion, said a report. Of the 40,000-50,000 tonnes of sugar which Sri Lanka consumes every month, 90% is sourced from India, the report stated. The Indian exporters have stopped sending onions there and the exporters who had traded are yet to receive payments, it said.
author: Subhangi Singh

headlines: Govt forms new trade advisory body; onboards TCS CEO, KKR India chief
text: The government has constituted a new Board of Trade, an advisory body to the Commerce and Industry Ministry. The 29-member board has been constituted by merging it with the existing Council for Trade Development and Promotion (CTDP), a notification by the Directorate General of Foreign Trade announced. The body includes TCS CEO Rajesh Gopinathan and KKR India Chairman Sanjay Nayyar.
author: Apurva Bharadwaj

headlines: Retail inflation eases marginally to 7.01% in June
text: The country’s retail inflation, which is measured by the Consumer Price Index (CPI), eased to 7.01% in the month of June. It stood at 7.04% in May. This comes amid easing crude and edible oil prices. Further, India's factory output, measured in terms of Index of Industrial Production (IIP), witnessed a growth of 19.6% in May.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: German auto components firm Bosch to invest over ₹200 crore in India
text: German auto components firm Bosch will invest ₹200 crore in India over next five years in advanced automotive technologies and digital mobility space, Managing Director Soumitra Bhattacharya said. The company is also "quietly and cautiously" optimistic about having double-digit growth in FY2022-23 over the previous fiscal, he added. In 2021-22, Bosch recorded a profit after tax of ₹1,217 crore.
author: Apurva Bharadwaj

headlines: Debt mutual funds see outflow of ₹92,248 cr in June: AMFI data
text: Mutual funds that invest in fixed-income securities, or debt funds, saw an outflow of ₹92,248 crore in June, Association of Mutual Funds in India (AMFI) data showed. Debt funds saw a net outflow of ₹32,722 crore in May and an inflow of ₹54,756 crore in April. Out of 16 fixed-income or debt fund categories, 14 witnessed net outflows in June.
author: Apurva Bharadwaj

headlines: I am naturally disappointed: Vijay Mallya on 4-month jail sentence
text: Fugitive businessman Vijay Mallya said he was "naturally disappointed" at the Supreme Court verdict sentencing him to four months in jail in a 2017 contempt of court case. Mallya was convicted of contempt in 2017 for transferring $40 million to his children in violation of court orders. The apex court also imposed a fine of ₹2,000 on him.
author: Apurva Bharadwaj

headlines: CBI may question senior journalist in NSE phone tapping case: Report
text: The Central Bureau of Investigation (CBI) is likely to question a senior journalist in Mumbai in connection with the alleged phone tapping of National Stock Exchange (NSE) employees, Moneycontrol reported. CBI found the journalist had introduced former Mumbai Police Commissioner Sanjay Pandey to former NSE CEO Chitra Ramkrishna. Pandey is also being probed in the matter.
author: Apurva Bharadwaj

headlines: IndiGo starts disciplinary proceedings after mass sick leaves: Report
text: IndiGo has started disciplinary proceedings against aeroplane maintenance technicians who went on mass sick leave for five days, PTI reported. The airline has asked concerned technicians to come in and see the airline doctor along with any appropriate medical records so the company can confirm they were genuinely ill, the report said. The technicians took leave to protest inadequate pay.
author: Apurva Bharadwaj

headlines: Hotel industry revenues to return to pre-COVID levels in FY23: ICRA
text: The hotel industry's revenues and margins are expected to return to pre-COVID levels in FY23, ratings agency ICRA said. Demand will be mainly driven by domestic leisure and transient travel, although there will be a gradual recovery in business travel and foreign tourist arrivals, ICRA said. Pan-India premium hotel occupancy is expected to be at 68-70% for FY23, it added.
author: Apurva Bharadwaj

headlines: Twitter calls Musk's withdrawal 'invalid & wrongful', says he 'knowingly' breached deal
text: Twitter has sent a letter to Tesla CEO Elon Musk after he terminated the $44 billion acquisition deal. Terming his withdrawal as "invalid and wrongful”, Twitter said Musk "knowingly" breached the deal. "Twitter demands that Musk and...other Musk Parties comply with their obligations under the Agreement...to consummate and make effective the transactions contemplated by the Agreement," it added.
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: Rupee hits historic low of 79.57 against US dollar
text: The Indian rupee hit a historic low of 79.57 against the US dollar during early trade on Tuesday. On Monday, the currency had ended at another record low of 79.44 per US dollar and had witnessed an intra-day high of 79.24.
